{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2014}} {{Infobox ice hockey player | name = Tyler Brown | image = | image_size = 230px | position = [[Winger (ice hockey)|Left Wing]] | shoots = Left | height_ft = 6 | height_in = 1 | weight_lb = 194 | team = [[Reading Royals]] | league = [[ECHL]] | former_teams = [[Adirondack Phantoms]]
[[Hartford Wolf Pack]] | prospect_team = | prospect_league = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|2|7}} | birth_place = [[Wasaga Beach, Ontario]], Canada | draft = Undrafted | career_start = 2011| }} '''Tyler G. Brown''' (born February 7, 1990) is a Canadian professional [[ice hockey]] [[Winger (ice hockey)|left winger]] who is currently playing with the [[Reading Royals]] of the [[ECHL]]. ==Playing career== Undrafted, Brown played major junior hockey with the [[Plymouth Whalers]] in the [[Ontario Hockey League]] before he was signed as a free agent to a three-year, entry-level contract with the [[Philadelphia Flyers]] on March 3, 2011.{{citeweb| url = https://www.nhl.com/flyers/news/flyers-sign-two-to-entry-level-contracts/c-554840 | title = Flyers sign two to entry-level deals | publisher = ''[[Philadelphia Flyers]]'' | date = 2011-03-03 | accessdate = 2015-04-06}} Following the [[2013-14 AHL season|2013–14]] season, the Flyers did not tender Brown a qualifying offer, leaving him as an unrestricted free agent. On September 5, 2014, the [[Greenville Road Warriors]] announced they had signed him to an ECHL contract.{{Cite web|url = http://www.greenvilleroadwarriors.com/news-parkes-brown.html|title = Road Warriors Add Over 300 games of AHL Experience with Two Signings|date = September 5, 2014|accessdate = September 5, 2014|website = Greenville Road Warriors Official Website|publisher = |last = |first = |deadurl = yes|archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140906000146/http://www.greenvilleroadwarriors.com/news-parkes-brown.html|archivedate = September 6, 2014|df = mdy-all}} After two seasons in the [[American Hockey League]] with the [[Hartford Wolf Pack]], Brown returned to Greenville as a free agent, signing a one-year deal with the [[Greenville Swamp Rabbits|Swamp Rabbits]] on September 12, 2016.{{citeweb| url = http://www.echl.com/brown-returns-to-swamp-rabbits | title = Brown returns to Swamp Rabbits | publisher = ''[[ECHL]]'' | date = 2016-09-12 | accessdate = 2016-09-12}} Following the [[2016-17 ECHL season|2016–17]] season, Brown opted to continue in the ECHL, returning within the Philadelphia Flyers affiliate's with the Reading Royals on September 28, 2017.{{Citeweb| url = https://royalshockey.com/royals-agree-to-terms-with-forward-tyler-brown/ | title = Royals agree to terms with forward Tyler Brown | publisher = ''[[Reading Royals]]'' | date = 2017-09-28 | accessdate = 2017-09-28}} ==Career statistics== {| border="0" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="0" style="text-align:center; width:60em" |- bgcolor="#e0e0e0" ! colspan="3" bgcolor="#ffffff" | ! rowspan="99" bgcolor="#ffffff" | ! colspan="5" | [[Regular season]] ! rowspan="99" bgcolor="#ffffff" | ! colspan="5" | [[Playoffs]] |- bgcolor="#e0e0e0" !
